content:
• Monday, January 23, 2012
  • ELPDF

    Elpida Memory (OTC:ELPDF +4%) is set to strike an alliance with Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU)...

    Elpida Memory (OTC:ELPDF +4%) is set to strike an alliance with Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU) and Taiwan's Nanya Technology, according to Japanese news sources. MU +1.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 PM
  • AZC

    Augusta Resource (AZC -11.6%) was hit hard today after the U.S. Forest Service extended its...

    Augusta Resource (AZC -11.6%) was hit hard today after the U.S. Forest Service extended its comment submission period for the draft environmental impact statement on the company's Rosemont copper project to January 31 from January 18 due to a technical email server problem.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 PM
  • DLB

    Dolby (DLB +6.5%) rallied today thanks to a bullish report from Brgantine's Barbara Coffey....

    Dolby (DLB +6.5%) rallied today thanks to a bullish report from Brgantine's Barbara Coffey. While considering 2012 a "transition year" for Dolby, Coffey considers shares to be undervalued, and has raised her PT to $40 from $32. Dolby shares fell 54% in 2011 due to weak earnings, concerns about soft DVD player sales, and Microsoft's decision not to integrate Dolby's audio technology into Windows 8.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:45 PM
  • ACUR

    Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR) says the new formulation of Pfizer's pain drug Oxecta, which...

    Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR) says the new formulation of Pfizer's pain drug Oxecta, which uses its tamper-resistant technology, is now available for sale. Shares +12.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM
  • CR

    Industrial equipment maker Crane (NYSE:CR) could see some weakness tomorrow after reporting Q4...

    Industrial equipment maker Crane (NYSE:CR) could see some weakness tomorrow after reporting Q4 revenue of $631.6M (+10% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.68, missing consensus by a solid $18.2M and $0.22. Crane is also guiding for 2012 revenue growth of 3%-5% (5.8% consensus) and EPS of $3.75-$3.95 ($3.86 consensus). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM
  • PLCM

    Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM) +14% AH, adding to earlier gains after its Q4 report, as the video...

    Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM) +14% AH, adding to earlier gains after its Q4 report, as the video conferencing and communications company issues upward guidance during its conference call. PLCM sees Q1 revenues down 2% from Q4, which would equal $398.9M vs. $397.82M consensus, and expects non-GAAP operating margin of 18%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) uses its FQ2 earnings call (webcast) to guide for FQ3 revenue of...

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) uses its FQ2 earnings call (webcast) to guide for FQ3 revenue of $2B-$2.15B ($2.05B consensus) and EPS of $1.15-$1.45 ($0.91 consensus). WDC +5.2% AH. STX +1.6%. (FQ2 results) (Thailand update)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM
  • STM

    More on STMicroelectronics' (NYSE:STM) Q4: The chipmaker expects Q1 revenue to decline 4%-10%...

    More on STMicroelectronics' (NYSE:STM) Q4: The chipmaker expects Q1 revenue to decline 4%-10% Q/Q (consensus is for 4% drop), largely thanks to weakness in its wireless division. Gross margin is expected to be 31.5%-34.5%, compared with Q4's 33.4%. Wireless sales fell 27% Y/Y in Q4, and the division's operating loss (excluding Ericsson's stake in ST-Ericsson) was $93M. STM +1.8%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • WWD

    Woodward (NASDAQ:WWD), a manufacturer of energy control systems, drops 3.9% AH after reporting...

    Woodward (NASDAQ:WWD), a manufacturer of energy control systems, drops 3.9% AH after reporting FQ1 revenue of $407.9M (+12% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.40, missing Street estimates by $17M and $0.04. The company is reiterating its FY12 (ends in September) guidance for revenue of $1.85B-$1.95B and EPS of $2.20-$2.35 (consensus is for $1.92B and $2.29).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • VMW

    More on VMware's (NYSE:VMW) Q4: The company's unearned revenue for the quarter was $474.3M, up...

    More on VMware's (NYSE:VMW) Q4: The company's unearned revenue for the quarter was $474.3M, up 34% Y/Y. Its total unearned revenue balance grew 21% Q/Q, to $2.71B. Free cash flow was $535M, up 32% Y/Y and easily outpacing net income of $200M. VMware expects Q1 revenue of $1.015B-$1.04B ($1.02B consensus) and 2012 revenue of $4.475B-$4.6B ($4.51B consensus). VMW +5.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • WDC

    More on Western Digital (NYSE:WDC): FQ2 beats on revenue as the company says its made...

    More on Western Digital (NYSE:WDC): FQ2 beats on revenue as the company says its made "significant additional progress to restore its manufacturing capacity following the recent flooding in Thailand." The company also addded that its manufacturing capacity should be back to pre-flood levels by the end of the September quarter. Shares +4.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC): FQ2 EPS of $0.61 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $2B (-2% Y/Y) beats by...

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC): FQ2 EPS of $0.61 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $2B (-2% Y/Y) beats by $160M. Shares +4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • TRX

    Shares of Tanzanian Royalty Exploration (TRX +5.6%) finished the day strong after the company...

    Shares of Tanzanian Royalty Exploration (TRX +5.6%) finished the day strong after the company announced more positive assay results from its ongoing drilling program at its Buckreef Project in the Lake Victoria Goldfields of Tanzania.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • IDCC

    More on InterDigital: The company is preannouncing Q4 revenue of $74.2M and EPS of $0.46, above...

    More on InterDigital: The company is preannouncing Q4 revenue of $74.2M and EPS of $0.46, above a consensus of $73.1M and $0.37. However, the news is only slightly reducing the hit taken by shares on account of the conclusion of InterDigital's "strategic review." IDCC -14.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • GEL

    Midstream oil & gas firm Genesis Energy (NYSE:GEL) falls 3.7% AH after announcing insiders...

    Midstream oil & gas firm Genesis Energy (NYSE:GEL) falls 3.7% AH after announcing insiders will sell 2.25M shares (about 3.1% of all outstanding shares) through a secondary offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) falls 18.1% AH after stating it has "concluded its review of...

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) falls 18.1% AH after stating it has "concluded its review of strategic alternatives" without agreeing to a sale. Shares had soared last summer on hopes that one or more wireless industry players would make a large bid for the company's 3G/4G patent portfolio, but trended lower following Google's purchase of Motorola Mobility.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • JJSF

    J & J Snack Foods (NASDAQ:JJSF): FQ1 EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $172.7M (+11%...

    J & J Snack Foods (NASDAQ:JJSF): FQ1 EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $172.7M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares -10.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • MMR

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR -5.6%) closes at its lows on the day after JP Morgan cut the shares to...

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR -5.6%) closes at its lows on the day after JP Morgan cut the shares to Underweight earlier today. the firm cites "significant risk" that upcoming results from the company's Davy Jones well-flow test "will be disappointing to the Street."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • PLCM

    Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM): Q4 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $407M (+20% Y/Y) beats by $6M....

    Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM): Q4 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $407M (+20% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares +6.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • AMN

    AMN Healthcare (AHS +9.8%) shares are hiked to Outperform from Market Perform at BMO, noting the...

    AMN Healthcare (AHS +9.8%) shares are hiked to Outperform from Market Perform at BMO, noting the healthcare staff provider - largest in the sector - should benefit from accelerating growth in 2012 as industry trends turn upward after the recession. BMO believes profit growth should improve, and AMN is priced more favorably than rival Cross Country Healthcare (CCRN +1.2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • LIVE

    Microcap B2B firm LiveDeal (LIVE +15%) jumps after saying on Friday in a SEC filing that it...

    Microcap B2B firm LiveDeal (LIVE +15%) jumps after saying on Friday in a SEC filing that it fired its president and CEO Kevin A. Hall. It names Jon Isaac as his replacement.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -4.8%) sells off after Bernstein writes that its checks with...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -4.8%) sells off after Bernstein writes that its checks with Keurig/K-Cup distributor Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY) lead it to believe Green Mountain's contribution to BBBY's growth will fall to ~50bps in FY12 from a current 140 bps. Green Mountain delivers its FQ1 report on Feb. 1.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • ALTH

    Part of J.P. Morgan's biotech (IBB -0.5%) cuts after the sector's recent run (I, II) include a...

    Part of J.P. Morgan's biotech (IBB -0.5%) cuts after the sector's recent run (I, II) include a move to Neutral from Overweight on Allos Therapeutics (ALTH +1.2%), noting that EU approval of its lymphoma drug looks at risk following last week's negative opinion from a European panel. Morgan's other calls lowered AMAG -6%, ACOR -0.5%, AMGN -2.5% and VPHM -2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • TLB

    Lazard Capital weighs in on the buzz about Talbots (TLB +3.1%) having its tires kicked by a pair...

    Lazard Capital weighs in on the buzz about Talbots (TLB +3.1%) having its tires kicked by a pair of P-E firms. Jennifer Davis calls a deal "likely," seeing the closing price for TLB in the $7 to $11 range. If she's correct, TLB's share price could end up as much as 4X higher than where it traded just last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • ZAGG

    ZAGG (ZAGG +5.7%) jumps after announcing the expansion of its AT&T product lineup with the...

    ZAGG (ZAGG +5.7%) jumps after announcing the expansion of its AT&T product lineup with the addition of the ZAGGsparq portable battery charger and ZAGGkeys FLEX gadget keyboard and stand.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • HAL

    Halliburton (HAL -2.4%) shares slip despite beating estimates with a 50% rise in Q4 earnings, as...

    Halliburton (HAL -2.4%) shares slip despite beating estimates with a 50% rise in Q4 earnings, as it shows "pretty unexpected" signs of slowing momentum in North America after posting revenue growth and margin improvements every quarter for the past two-and-a-half years, Canaccord says. Rival Baker Hughes (BHI -2.8%) also is lower ahead of its Q4 results tomorrow.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • BCRX

    Shares of BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (BCRX +5.3%) trade higher on heavy volume after a swine flu...

    Shares of BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (BCRX +5.3%) trade higher on heavy volume after a swine flu outbreak in Mexico garners attention on the firm's research in the area. Also running up a significant gain on the news is Novavax +8.1%. (previous).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • RBGPF

    Shares of Schiff Nutrition (WNI +3.8%)are up after at C.L. King upgraded the stock to Buy from...

    Shares of Schiff Nutrition (WNI +3.8%)are up after at C.L. King upgraded the stock to Buy from Neutral on valuation earlier today.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • SWN

    Southwestern Energy (SWN +10.1%) catches an upgrade to Outperform from BMO Capital with analysts...

    Southwestern Energy (SWN +10.1%) catches an upgrade to Outperform from BMO Capital with analysts calling out a favorable risk-reward proposition for investors. Goldman also takes a liking to shares, naming the firm as the best positioned in the sector to take advantage of higher natural gas prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • LXK

    Lexmark International (LXK +1.3%) signs a five-year agreement with Anheuser-Busch to provide...

    Lexmark International (LXK +1.3%) signs a five-year agreement with Anheuser-Busch to provide managed print services and products to help improve its business processes. As part of the deal, the company will also deploy a standardized fleet of printers and multifunction products.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW -2.6%) is set to report its Q4 after the bell, and Collins Stewart believes the...

    VMware (VMW -2.6%) is set to report its Q4 after the bell, and Collins Stewart believes the company "closed another strong quarter" as its server virtualization and cloud computing tools remain aligned with clients' tech priorities. "With the shares trading down recently, in-line with the software group, we find them attractive," the firm says. But VMW tends to trade lower post-earnings in any case.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • PCXCQ

    Higher natural gas prices help prop up shares of Patriot Coal (PCX +8.9%) and take the sting off...

    Higher natural gas prices help prop up shares of Patriot Coal (PCX +8.9%) and take the sting off the news that S&P placed the company on credit watch for a possible downgrade. Other coal names advancing off of spiking gas prices: JRCC +6.6%, ANR +4.6%, CNX +4.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • CLR

    Continental Resources (CLR +1.9%) trades higher despite being downgraded to Hold on valuation at...

    Continental Resources (CLR +1.9%) trades higher despite being downgraded to Hold on valuation at Jefferies, citing deteriorating natural gas fundamentals.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • BSRR

    Sierra Bancorp (BSRR -1.9%) dips after posting weak Q4 earnings of $0.11 per diluted share, down...

    Sierra Bancorp (BSRR -1.9%) dips after posting weak Q4 earnings of $0.11 per diluted share, down from the prior year period. The company attributes the decline to a 39 basis point drop in its net interest margin.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • SR-OLD

    Standard Register (SR-OLD -11.1%) gets hit after the company says it plans to lay off 12% to 15%...

    Standard Register (SR-OLD -11.1%) gets hit after the company says it plans to lay off 12% to 15% of its work force as part of a restructuring effort to save the company about $45M a year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • MERC

    Mercer (MERC -2.1%) dips following a downgrade to Underperform on valuation at BMO Capital,...

    Mercer (MERC -2.1%) dips following a downgrade to Underperform on valuation at BMO Capital, citing poor pulp fundamentals.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • EEFT

    Euronet Worldwide (NASDAQ:EEFT) discloses that a small portion of its European business was the...

    Euronet Worldwide (NASDAQ:EEFT) discloses that a small portion of its European business was the target of a criminal computer security breach late last year and that it took immediate steps to ensure the impact of the breach was contained. Shares -3.5%. (submitted by Holly Thompson)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • CNQR

    Concur Technologies (CNQR -3.5%) trades lower after FBR cuts the shares to Market Perform on...

    Concur Technologies (CNQR -3.5%) trades lower after FBR cuts the shares to Market Perform on valuation, citing moderating growth in corporate travel.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • LTRE

    Learning Tree (OTC:LTRE +1.5%) says its CFO Bob Waldron is leaving the company after accepting a...

    Learning Tree (OTC:LTRE +1.5%) says its CFO Bob Waldron is leaving the company after accepting a position with privately-held biofuels company Sundrop Fuels. The company has a conference call scheduled today to discuss leadership changes.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • CVM

    Cel-Sci Corporation (CVM +8%) pops after saying late Friday that phase III clinical trials for...

    Cel-Sci Corporation (CVM +8%) pops after saying late Friday that phase III clinical trials for its cancer drug Multikine were launched in dozens of hospitals located in eight countries on three continents.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • SGMS

    Shares of Scientific Games (SGMS -8.1%) trade lower off of a report saying that a JV between the...

    Shares of Scientific Games (SGMS -8.1%) trade lower off of a report saying that a JV between the firm and gaming software firm Playtech has broken down.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • BB

    Criticism of new Research In Motion (RIMM -6.4%) CEO Thorsten Heins is piling up. Paul Kedrosky...

    Criticism of new Research In Motion (RIMM -6.4%) CEO Thorsten Heins is piling up. Paul Kedrosky calls him an "un-coachable corporate droid," while Jay Yarow thinks he could be worse than his predecessors, who at least built RIM into a giant. One devil's advocate response: Might Heins be trying to say the "right" things to mollify Lazaridis and Balsillie, who were quite reluctant to step down? (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 5 Comments
  • JIVE

    Analysts weigh in on Jive Software (JIVE -2.7%) as the provider of social collaboration software...

    Analysts weigh in on Jive Software (JIVE -2.7%) as the provider of social collaboration software exits its post-IPO quiet period. Most are neutral, but Citigroup sets a Buy rating and thinks JIVE eventually will get acquired: “As leader in enterprise social, we expect larger companies such as SAP and IBM are potential buyers... Our takeout analysis suggests valuation of $21-$24 in one year.”

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • PNRA

    Panera Bread (PNRA -3.6%) trades lower after Raymond James cut the shares to Market Perform on...

    Panera Bread (PNRA -3.6%) trades lower after Raymond James cut the shares to Market Perform on valuation earlier this morning. The stock has been a powerhouse recently, having gained over 40% since late October.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • NVAX

    Shares of vaccine maker Novavax (NVAX +5.4%) surge as nine people die from an outbreak of swine...

    Shares of vaccine maker Novavax (NVAX +5.4%) surge as nine people die from an outbreak of swine flu in Mexico, with the number of cases almost doubling in a week. Earlier this month, 12 American citizens were reported as infected with H1N1 flu, with fears that the virus had mutated to H3N2v - the strain transmitted from human-to-human.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • OMEX

    Odyssey Marine Exploration (NASDAQ:OMEX) knocks out a 7.6% gain after a report tips off that the...

    Odyssey Marine Exploration (NASDAQ:OMEX) knocks out a 7.6% gain after a report tips off that the high-tech salvage company landed the contract to recover the British warship H.M.S. Victory that has sat on the floor of the Atlantic since 1744.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC +2.9%) continues its surprising run, adding to its 31% YTD gain as it...

    Bank of America (BAC +2.9%) continues its surprising run, adding to its 31% YTD gain as it easily outperforms the broader market and other big banks. Evercore tries to explain, even as several analysts have hacked their target prices since last week's earnings report: “Seems like greater risk appetite to start new year, some better macro, and more comfort around BAC’s capital position.”

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • ALXA

    Shares of microcap biotech firm Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA -14.6%) get slammed after the FDA...

    Shares of microcap biotech firm Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA -14.6%) get slammed after the FDA says it needs an additional three months to complete its review of the company's new drug application for Adasuve, a schizophrenic and bipolar disorder treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • HDY

    Hyperdynamics (HDY -6.4%) takes a hit with word that the firm experienced drilling problems off...

    Hyperdynamics (HDY -6.4%) takes a hit with word that the firm experienced drilling problems off the shore of the coast of Republic of Guinea that will cause operations to be suspended for a week.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • MMM

    Shares of Ceradyne (CRDN -2.9%) trade off quickly after DA Davidson takes its rating to Neutral...

    Shares of Ceradyne (CRDN -2.9%) trade off quickly after DA Davidson takes its rating to Neutral from Buy and clips its price target on the stock by $5 to $36.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • QUMU

    Digital data delivery provider Rimage (RIMG -11.8%) gets hit after cutting its Q4 guidance as...

    Digital data delivery provider Rimage (RIMG -11.8%) gets hit after cutting its Q4 guidance as revenue from a recently acquired business fell short of expectations. The company now expects to report a Q4 loss of between $0.12and $0.14 per share on revenue of $22M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • TWIN

    Twin Disc (TWIN -17.1%) tumbles after missing the consensus estimate of analysts with its FQ2...

    Twin Disc (TWIN -17.1%) tumbles after missing the consensus estimate of analysts with its FQ2 report even after it received a big boost from the favorable foreign currency movements of the Euro, Canadian Dollar, and Swiss Franc during the period.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • CBR

    Ciber (CBR +7.5%) rallies after agreeing to sell its federal services business to...

    Ciber (CBR +7.5%) rallies after agreeing to sell its federal services business to privately-owned CRGT for net cash proceeds of ~$35M. Weak federal sales had a lot to do with the IT services firm's poor 2011 performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Traders continue to marvel at the mind-numbing 2012 rally in shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD) -...

    Traders continue to marvel at the mind-numbing 2012 rally in shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD) - now up 69% YTD after factoring in a tidy 8.4% gain in today's action. Speculation continues to ramp up that the "epic" taking apart of shorts is a FOE (Friends of Eddie) play.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • PG

    Stifel Nicolaus cuts Procter & Gamble (PG -1.7%) to Hold from Buy and lowers its EPS...

    Stifel Nicolaus cuts Procter & Gamble (PG -1.7%) to Hold from Buy and lowers its EPS estimate, due to impact from currencies and worsening input costs. The firm says PG may need to boost promotions as competitors didn’t follow its lead in raising prices in certain areas, causing a drop in market share. Morgan Stanley cut PG shares earlier for similar reasons.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • NFLX

    Piper Jaffray remains a believer in Netflix (NFLX -3.8%) ahead of its Q4 report this Wednesday,...

    Piper Jaffray remains a believer in Netflix (NFLX -3.8%) ahead of its Q4 report this Wednesday, differing from other more gloomy assessments. Despite "shooting itself in the foot," NFLX still has a significant lead in online subscription video, the firm says. "Expectations have been reset and investors are becoming increasingly comfortable that churn will stabilize and gross adds will return."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • AMG

    Shares of AMAG Pharmaceuticals (AMG -4.4%) move lower after the firm takes on a downgrade from...

    Shares of AMAG Pharmaceuticals (AMG -4.4%) move lower after the firm takes on a downgrade from JPMorgan to Underweight. The ratings move on AMAG is part of a larger sector call that includes VPHM, ACOR, AMGN, and ALTH all getting slashed on valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • QLGC

    QLogic (QLGC -0.1%) is selling its InfiniBand adapter card and switch business to Intel...

    QLogic (QLGC -0.1%) is selling its InfiniBand adapter card and switch business to Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) for $125M in cash. The move allows QLogic to focus on its core Fibre Channel and FCoE storage networking businesses, and is the latest in a series of moves made by Intel to bolster its networking offerings (previously). InfiniBand chipmaker Mellanox (MLNX -5.4%) is selling off on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • GTHP

    Shares of Guided Therapeutics (OTCQB:GTHP) fall 52.5% premarket on reports that the firm's cash...

    Shares of Guided Therapeutics (OTCQB:GTHP) fall 52.5% premarket on reports that the firm's cash position is dangerously low and that the application for approval with the EU for its Luliva treatment (.pdf) is only a head fake for potential trouble it's having landing approval with the FDA in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) -1.8% premarket after Wedbush reiterates a Sell ahead of Wednesday's Q4...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) -1.8% premarket after Wedbush reiterates a Sell ahead of Wednesday's Q4 report. The firm expects a repeat of Netflix's Q3 disaster (I, II) to unfold, with solid Q4 results being overshadowed by guidance for heavy Q1 losses. Wedbush sees Netflix guiding for Q1 EPS of -$0.62, well below a -$0.29 consensus, and also sees 2012 consensus estimates falling by at least $1/share. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM Radio (NASDAQ:SIRI) -2.4% premarket after Morgan Stanley lowers its rating to Equal...

    Sirius XM Radio (NASDAQ:SIRI) -2.4% premarket after Morgan Stanley lowers its rating to Equal Weight from Overweight, warning the Street’s 2012 subscriber growth forecasts may be too high and that some analysts have “an overly benign view of customer reaction” to SIRI’s recent price increase. Shares have climbed 15% since SIRI pre-announced Q4 subscriber growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM

  • Market preview: S&P benchmark futures are flat, although EU stocks are green, led by banks...

    Market preview: S&P benchmark futures are flat, although EU stocks are green, led by banks on reports of a Franco-German push to weaken capital rules. RIM is -4.4% and reversing sharply following a damp squib of a conference call with new CEO Thorsten Heins. Natural gas producers are higher in the wake of Chesapeake's (+7%) production cut and a rise in prices.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • OCSL

    Shares of Fifth Street Finance (FSC) dip 4.4% premarket after the firm announces a 10M public...

    Shares of Fifth Street Finance (FSC) dip 4.4% premarket after the firm announces a 10M public offering of common stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 2 Comments
  • BB

    Research in Motion (RIMM -3.9%) reverses big early gains in the wake of an uninspiring...

    Research in Motion (RIMM -3.9%) reverses big early gains in the wake of an uninspiring conference call with new CEO Thorsten Heins. "This is not a seismic change, it's a scaling up of the company." Ugh.
